alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 2:18PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe and northeastern Arkansas Counties through 245 PM CST... At 217 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wheatley to near Allendale to Clarendon to 8 miles southeast of Roe to near Almyra. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brinkley... Clarendon... Holly Grove... Almyra... St. Charles... Alfrey... Allendale... Palmer... De Witt... Fargo... Blackton... Aberdeen... Monroe... Casscoe... Crocketts Bluff... Ragtown... Indian Bay... Pine City... Keevil... Zent... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 214 and 218. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for southeastern Arkansas.
